result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 10/28/2017.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
Restitution set at zero.
No drivers license suspension.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick J Hayes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Defendant Patrick J Hayes in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 12 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 7 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 10/28/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 10/28/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is not in a condition to proceed with sentencing on todays date. Case rescheduled for 10/28/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Summary received and filed.
Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed. No action taken. sab

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 10/27/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-27-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves for an adjournment.  State has no objection.  Defense moves to have random testing removed from monitoring due to his preexisting medical condition.  Court denies motion.  Court orders defendant to provide the letter to Justice Point at his visits.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Court orders no action taken at this time - place report in file./ds
Violation report received and filed - refusal./ds

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  William Levins for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State would like to set this case after the change of pleas in the codefendants cases.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State advises the Court she will move to join this case with the codefendants' homicide case when it is assigned.  Court addresses the Justice Point report.  Defense has provided proof of defendant's medical condition.  Court orders defendant to provide this to Justice Point after Court today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court will address the medical condition at the next hearing./ds
Violation report received and filed./ds

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State has received the toxicology, autopsy and interview of the medical examiner reports.  State needs to meet with the attorney for further discussions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Paul Hauer for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Defendants Melissa Braunreiter and Brad Hoppe

Defendant Patrick J Hayes in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Patrick J Hayes in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
